intro: Loeseneriella urceolus var. xerophila, commonly known as the desert shield fern, is a rare and specialized plant adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form. The plant produces small, orbicular to reniform fronds that are densely packed, reducing water loss through transpiration. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or crevice habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
